incidents.name: Delays in Retrieving Some Historical Messaging Data

incident_updates.body: All historical data about messages that are requested via the Console or API is now up to date, and all queued information about messages have been processed.  The service is operating normally at this time.

All historical data about messages that are requested via the Console or API is now up to date, and all queued information about messages have been processed. We are monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery, and we will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

For customers who are requesting historical data about messages that have been sent during the past 7 hours via the Console or API, there is a small probability that the data could be delayed. The root cause has been identified and eliminated. We have started to process the queued messages and expect to provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

For customers who are requesting historical data about messages, that have been sent during the past 7 hours, via the Console or API, there is a small probability that the data could be delayed. incidents.name: Black Friday / Cyber Monday Alert

incident_updates.body: Due to increased traffic demand on mobile communication networks, we will expect potential congestion for US carrier networks during the Black Friday and Cyber Monday period. Customers may experience intermittent SMS and MMS delivery delays. Please refer to our Black Friday / Cyber Monday FAQ page, in the Help Center on Twilio.com, for more information.

incidents.name: Failed Messaging Callbacks

incident_updates.body: Twilio Messaging callbacks were degraded between 18:00 UTC and 23:00 UTC on 22nd November. During this period of time customers may have experienced failed callbacks.  This incident has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Twilio Console Not Logging in or Loading for Logged-in Users

incident_updates.body: All services impacted by an issue with Twilio Console have recovered and are operating as intended. This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery; please note that some users may still receive errors or experience some latencies when logging into the Twilio Console. Engineering teams continue working to ensure errors are completely resolved. We will provide another update in 12 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are observing recovery; please note that some users may still receive errors or experience some latencies when logging into the Twilio Console. Engineering teams continue working to ensure errors are completely resolved. We will provide another update in 12 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are still working on resolving the issue causing degraded performance on our account portal; users may still be unable to log in to the Twilio Console. Our engineering team is working diligently to remediate the issue.

Flex customers who have SSO setup through a 3rd party Identity Provider (Google, Okta, Salesforce, etc.) will be able to log into Flex this way without issue; login from Console is the only login method not working.

We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
